p: But these wild edible plants do not sell in the market nowadays. However, the wild edible plant called Tamarindus is still sold in the local market even though there is no food scarcity in the study area [ 76]. On the other hand, Alemayehu et al. [ 69] reported that there were no wild edible plants sold in the market at Berehet District, North Shewa Zone of Amhara Region, Ethiopia.
